ETYMOLOGY: From Old French jolif ('festive, merry'), from Old Norse jól ('a midwinter feast'), which is also the origin of the English word 'Yule'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Full of high spirits and happiness; cheerful and lively.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 心情愉快的；高兴的；快活的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He always has a jolly smile on his face, especially during the holidays.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他脸上总是带着愉快的笑容，尤其是在假期里。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to emphasize an adjective or adverb; very or extremely.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 非常，极其（尤指英式口语中作形容词或副词的强调语）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: That's a jolly good film, you should definitely watch it.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那真是一部非常好的电影，你绝对应该看看。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that requires one or more objects to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To encourage or amuse someone, often to keep them in good humor.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （通过奉承或鼓励）使（某人）高兴，打趣；哄劝。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We had to jolly him along to finish his homework before dinner.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们不得不哄他开心，让他晚饭前完成作业。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An enjoyable outing, excursion, or celebration.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 愉快的郊游、旅行或庆祝活动；聚会。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The staff went on a jolly to the coast for their annual team-building event.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 员工们每年都会去海边进行一次愉快的团建活动。

REGISTER: General, with some informal/British English uses.
